intro: Rauvolfia amsoniifolia, commonly known as the Florida rauvolfia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially sunny environments. This species is often found in wetlands, hammocks, and along stream banks.
